com.MASTAdView
Interface MASTAdDelegate.ThirdPartyEventHandler

Enclosing class:
MASTAdDelegate
public static interface MASTAdDelegate.ThirdPartyEventHandler

Interface for third party ad requests, with an onThirdPartyEvent() method invoked when client-side third party ad requests are received by the SDK. In this case the only action taken by the SDK is to notify the app via this callback; the remaining work for integrating and displaying ads with a third party SDK is the application developers responsibility.

Method Summary
 void onThirdPartyEvent(MASTAdView sender, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
          Invoked when third party ad requests are being handled.
 

Method Detail

onThirdPartyEvent

void onThirdPartyEvent(MASTAdView sender,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
Invoked when third party ad requests are being handled.

Parameters:
sender - The originating ad view where the event was triggered.
params - Parameters for the event. The parameters will include name/value pairs for the "type", "campaign" and "track_url" standard items, plus any additional data received in the ad response.

A sample which executes a custom method when a third party request occurs is as follows: 

 class UserOnThirdPartyRequest implements ThirdPartyEventHandler {
     public void onThirdPartyEvent(MASTAdView arg0, HashMap arg1) {
         // This class method is responsible for invoking a handler to run
         // code on the UI thread that displays information about the request.
         updateUi(arg1.toString());
     }  
 }
   
 adserverView.getAdDelegate().setThirdPartyRequestHandler(new UserOnThirdPartyRequest());

See the sample application source code for complete source for this use case.
